keyMoments.title: Diamante's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Diamante appears at the Donquixote Pirates executive meeting. Doflamingo praises him for his supervision of the Corrida Colosseum and entrusts him with the Mera Mera no Mi for the tournament.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the top executives of the Donquixote Pirates who will oversee the Corrida Colosseum tournament.

reveals.information: First appearance as Donquixote Pirates executive officer

keyMoments.title: Trebol's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Trebol appears at the Donquixote Pirates executive meeting, shown high above on a tower. He interacts with Baby 5 who informs him that Doflamingo asked for him.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the top executives of the Donquixote Pirates and one of Doflamingo's closest advisors.

reveals.information: First appearance as Donquixote Pirates executive officer

keyMoments.title: Pica's First Appearance in Shadow
keyMoments.description: Pica makes his debut appearance in shadows at the Donquixote Pirates executive meeting.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the top executives of the Donquixote Pirates, though his full appearance and abilities aren't yet revealed.

reveals.information: First appearance as Donquixote Pirates executive officer

keyMoments.title: Baby 5's Appearance at Executive Meeting
keyMoments.description: Baby 5 appears at the Donquixote Pirates meeting, interacting with Trebol. When Trebol jokingly asks her to marry him, she is yelled at by other executives.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Baby 5 as a member of the Donquixote Pirates and hints at her character trait of accepting any proposal.

reveals.information: First appearance as member of Donquixote Pirates

keyMoments.title: Brannew Announces Current Warlords
keyMoments.description: Commodore Brannew gives a presentation at Marine Headquarters about the Seven Warlords of the Sea, listing the current roster including the newly appointed Buggy.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Brannew as a Marine intelligence officer who provides exposition about major world events and power structures.

reveals.information: First appearance as Marine intelligence officer

keyMoments.title: Buggy Revealed as Warlord
keyMoments.description: Buggy is officially revealed to have become one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea during the timeskip. In an anime-original scene, he declares he'll become a Four Emperor and then Pirate King.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Buggy's continued improbable rise in status due to his reputation from Marineford and connection to Gol D. Roger. The anime's addition of his Emperor declaration is prophetic.
keyMoments.quote: No one expected me to become a Warlord! Next, I'll become one of the Four Emperors, and then the Pirate King!

reveals.information: Became one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea
Leader of the Pirate Dispatch organization

keyMoments.title: Bonney Reacts to Luffy-Law Alliance
keyMoments.description: Jewelry Bonney is shown reading about Luffy and Law's alliance while eating pizza. She appears alone, possibly after her crew was destroyed by Blackbeard.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Bonney's continued presence in the New World and her awareness of major events involving the Worst Generation.

reveals.information: Appears to be alone, possibly after crew was wiped out by Blackbeard

keyMoments.title: Kid Analyzes Luffy-Law Alliance
keyMoments.description: Eustass Kid reads about Luffy and Law's alliance and correctly deduces they must be targeting one of the Four Emperors, wondering which one it is.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Kid's strategic intelligence and establishes him as having similar ambitions to Luffy regarding taking down the Emperors.
keyMoments.quote: Luffy and Law teaming up... They must be going after one of the Four Emperors too.

reveals.information: Shows strategic thinking and understanding of New World power dynamics
Implies he's also targeting the Four Emperors

keyMoments.title: Jinbe's Reaction to the News
keyMoments.description: Jinbe is shown reading about Doflamingo's resignation and the Luffy-Law alliance, expressing concern about the trouble these alliances will cause.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Jinbe's continued awareness of Luffy's activities and his concern for his future captain's safety.

reveals.information: Continues to monitor Luffy's activities with concern

keyMoments.title: Crocodile's New World Cameo
keyMoments.description: A shadowy figure with Crocodile's trademark fur coat and golden hook is shown reading the news. The anime confirms this is Crocodile, whereas the manga kept it ambiguous.
keyMoments.significance: Confirms Crocodile's presence in the New World and his continued interest in major events. This is an anime-original confirmation.

reveals.information: Confirmed to be in the New World (anime-original clarification)

name.japanese: ドンキホーテ・ドフラミンゴ

keyMoments.title: Doflamingo's Resignation Announced
keyMoments.description: News breaks that Doflamingo has resigned from the Seven Warlords, which is revealed to be a strategic move to lure Luffy and Law to Dressrosa.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the entire Dressrosa Arc conflict. Shows Doflamingo as a master strategist willing to sacrifice his Warlord position for his larger plans.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Possession of Mera Mera no Mi
keyMoments.description: Doflamingo reveals he possesses Ace's former Devil Fruit, the Mera Mera no Mi, and plans to use it as the prize in a Corrida Colosseum tournament to lure Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most shocking reveals of the arc. Shows Doflamingo's cruel psychological manipulation and sets up the tournament subplot.
keyMoments.quote: There's no way Luffy would let anyone have his brother's power.

reveals.information: Used fake resignation as bait for Luffy and Law
Possesses the Mera Mera no Mi (Ace's former Devil Fruit)

name.japanese: トラファルガー・ロー

keyMoments.title: Law Explains SMILE Factory Plan
keyMoments.description: Law explains his strategic plan to destroy the SMILE Factory on Dressrosa while Doflamingo is distracted by the hostage exchange at Green Bit.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the true objective of the Dressrosa mission and Law's tactical approach to taking down Doflamingo.

reveals.information: Plans to destroy the SMILE Factory to disrupt Kaido's operations

keyMoments.title: Sakazuki Dispatches Fujitora
keyMoments.description: Fleet Admiral Sakazuki dispatches Admiral Fujitora to deal with the situation involving Doflamingo, Luffy, and Law.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Sakazuki's aggressive approach to dealing with threats and introduces Fujitora's mission.

reveals.information: Takes direct action against Luffy-Law alliance by sending an Admiral
